questions.question: There ............................ someone at the gate.
questions.description: When the noun following there is singular, use a singular verb.

questions.question: ............................ there anything we can do about it?
questions.description: When the noun following there is singular, use a singular verb.

questions.question: There .................................. so many children in the park.
questions.description: When the noun following there is plural, use a plural verb.

questions.question: There .................................. lots of apples on the tree.
questions.description: When the noun following there is plural, use a plural verb.

questions.question: Ten or fifteen years ago, there ............................. much less traffic on the roads.
questions.description: When the noun following there is singular, use a singular verb.

questions.question: There ................................ so little time.
questions.description: When the noun following there is singular, use a singular verb.

questions.question: There ................................ too much violence on television.
questions.description: When the noun following there is singular, use a singular verb.

questions.question: ................................ there anything good on television tonight?
questions.description: When the noun following there is singular, use a singular verb.

questions.question: There .................................. anything we can do.
questions.description: When the noun following there is singular, use a singular verb.

questions.question: .................................. there any letters for me?
questions.description: When the noun following there is plural, use a plural verb.

questions.question: There ..................................... no libraries in my village.
questions.description: When the noun following there is plural, use a plural verb.

questions.question: There .................................... enough volunteers.
questions.description: When the noun following there is plural, use a plural verb.
